reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I'm building several computers to use in my dental practice and I wanted something compact yet powerful for running dental imaging software, web browsing, YouTube and practice management software. My goal was not to build a high-end gaming rig. This computer is not for overclocking either. If you want a gaming rig go build one. If you need something that runs everyday work continue reading. Also, I'm AMD fan.BUILD SETUP:1. AMD Ryzen 3 3200G with Radeon Graphics APU (4 core CPU with Radeon Graphics). 65 W TDP and max temp 95 C. ($91.95).2. Gigabyte B450 I AORUS PRO WIFI (AMD Ryzen AM4/M.2 Thermal Guard with Onboard Wifi/HDMI/DP/USB 3.1 Gen 2/Mini ITX/Motherboard) ($141.12).3. Sabrent 256GB Rocket NVMe PCIe M.2 2280 Internal SSD High Performance Solid State Drive (SB-ROCKET-256) ($46.99)4. Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 DRAM 3200MHz C16 Desktop Memory Kit - Black (CMK16GX4M2B3200C16),Vengeance LPX Black ($73.99)5. Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo - Keyboard and Mouse Included, 2.4GHz Dropout-Free Connection, Long Battery Life (Frustration-Free Packaging) ($20.99)6. InWin Chopin SECC Mini-ITX Tower Case 150W Power Supply with 4 colors stickers inside, Black Aluminum ($90.34)7. 24" DisplayPROS:1. The case has an amazing build quality. It feels premium with the black aluminum material. High quality finish and sturdy.2. Small form factor. Quite portable.3. AMD Ryzen 3 3200G is quite powerful for everything you throw at it. The nice part is that it has a built-in Radeon GPU so you can use the motherboard display out to power your displays. It supports 4K. It has 2 HDMI and 1 Display Port!4. Sabrent NVME is incredible. Windows 10 boots in 10-12 sec! Price is unbelievable.5. Built-in WiFi AC with antenna and Bluetooth 5.0. I love motherboards that have those!6. The case comes with 150 PSU. AMD with Radeon is max at 65 W so you wont be running the PSU at max. No noise from PSU and the CPU cooler fan is silent under normal operation.CONS:The case wont fit the AMD Wraith Silent cooler, without a slight modification.SOLUTION:It won't fit unless you remove the top bracket. Yes, it can fit!! It took me some time to figure it out and I wanted to share this with everyone. The stock AMD Wraith Silent cooler fits this case after you remove the top bracket from the fan. See pictures and video attached. The benefit is that you don't have to buy a separate cooler. I found that Noctua $39.90 is way too much to spend so that pushed me to figure out a solution.Plus the AMD cooler is bigger and since the fan is so close to the side panel. It will force air out of the case through the mesh.EXPERIENCE:Motherboard:The Gigabyte motherboard is incredible. The UEFI BIOS is graphics with mouse support. It came with latest BIOS revision 50 out of the box. Good job Gigabyte! (Hint: if you want to upgrade your BIOS do not do it from Windows. Always do it from the BIOS menu so no bricks). Windows 10 had no issues installing or running. All drivers installed without a problem. Radeon drivers worked out of the box. Also Miracast works on this APU with drivers 20.xx. I was able to wireless cast HDMI to a Anycast dongle and mirror my desktop.Boot time is 10-12 seconds! If your display is on standby and you push the power button by the time the monitor wakes up you're at Windows login screen. Unbelievable speed! WiFi and BT are great and coupled with 16 GB of RAM the GPU takes 2 GB and the rest is dedicated to Windows. Performance is great. It also supports Windows secure boot and other gems. Everything is so smooth.CPU Heat:Under idle conditions, the CPU temperature is around 28 C. With load you probably hit 40-50 C. I did not do extensive testing. Remember this is APU based on Zen+ architecture so it's not a 7nm APU. Hopefully, we get newer Zen 2 APUs from AMD. I love AMD !Overclocking:I do not do overclocking. My goal is usually to reduce power consumption if possible and have a quite system. The default AMD boost is way more than enough for my needs. I hate when people trash companies and motherboard because of VRM and such. If you want to overclock get a higher end and more expensive motherboard but let us enjoy those gems like the Gigabyte B450 I AORUS PRO WIFI.NOISE:Not so much. See the video. PSU does not make sound either. I tested it by unplugging the CPU fan to see. In fact that this case comes with PSU at this price is so cool. I wish more companies offer that.PERFORMANCE:If you need a computer that does everyday work you wont be disappointed. This setup is quite light and has AMD technologies. Thank you In Win Chopin for this wonderful case!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars excellent, works well, and I recommend it.
reviews.reviewText: This processor works much better than I thought, and it also works better than many people had told me, I did a lot of research before buying it and I have to say that it exceeds all the expectations I had, I have been using it for more than a year and it still works great, I use this computer for programming, but I also play a lot, I feel very happy and satisfied with this processor and its performance.Here are some of the games I've played: -Raging 2. -Assassin's Creed Syndicate. -all three Tomb Raider. -A Plague Tale. -Genshin Impact. - Battle Front I. -RocketLeague. -Rime. -Nioh: the complete edition (I didn't play this much, I don't have a controller and the keyboard doesn't work well) -Subway 2033 Redux. -Metro Last Light Redux. -I played all of these games on ultra. -Control (I played this on medium)I have played many more, but more or less we can see that it can run some games, this does not mean that it is a miraculous machine, but if like me you do not have a lot of money and want to have something for a few months or a year it can be useful, and you can even upgrade the parts later if needed.I have 16GB of ram, two disks, a solid 240GB, and a 750GB that my cousin gave to me is very old and slow but it works just fine because I needed the storage space.please note that this is a review of how this processor has worked for me, you have to do your own research so you don't waste your money.Finally, thanks for your time and sorry my English is bad, but I think this information can be useful to you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good choice for a budget build
reviews.reviewText: I did my last build in 2012 and thought it was about time I upgraded one of my home desktops that is used principally for internet browsing, watching Amazon Prime and paying the bills online. I don't have the least interest in 'gaming' (aka sitting on one's butt for hours or days at a time).I chose this processor mainly for the price. It has 4 processor cores and can run 4 threads 'simultaneously'. This is more than enough processing power for the uses mentioned above.Another significant reason was that it has integrated graphics. This means that you don't have to buy a separate graphics card for your build which is at least a saving of %150.It comes with a heat sink which is more than adequate to cool the processor. I have two other fans in my computer case and (so far) I have never seen my PC running hotter than 47 C. Of course, I am not doing any heavy video editing or anything else that makes CPU usage go up to 100% on all cores.Please note that this processor uses an AMD AM4 socket. Remember this when choosing your motherboard!The performance on most of the applications listed above is great. Windows 10 boots up in just a few seconds. (Of course, this is partly due to using NVMe storage. I highly recommend this at least for installing your operating system. If you wish to install this storage, make sure your motherboard has at least 1 M2 socket and that the dimensions of the storage stick are consistent with the interface on your motherboard).If you're looking to a budget build, this processor is great choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for First builds.
reviews.reviewText: When looming to start a PC build on a budget the AMD Ryzen 3 3200g is the one that I recommend. It’s affordable it it will be able to process just about anything you throw at it. I kept a my budget low and my pc ran like a beast. Running games wonderfully. Especially because this CPU comes with a built in GPU. Of course it’s not the best GPU but it definitely helps those out there hoping to get into simple games such as league of legends.

A entrega foi muito rápida e o produto veio muito bem embalado. O processador é ótimo, me atende muito bemm, não testei ainda em jogos mas tenho certeza que rodará muito bem eles(até porque no YouTube têm vários videos dele rodando jogos muito bemm), simplesmente incrivel, recomendo muitoo!
low Budget best performing gaming processor

reviews.reviewerName: Gustavo Adolfo Santes SantiagoGustavo Adolfo Santes Santiago
reviews.reviewTitle: Procesador Ryzen Zen+ con buen redimiento a precio recomendado
reviews.reviewText: Me encantó el rendimiento de la plataforma mas moderna que haya puesto AMD sobre el mercado, y este modelo refleja eso: eficiencia, calidad, rapidez y comodidad en un solo producto. Lo que me hizo decantar por una plataforma AMD Ryzen en lugar de una Intel con el chipset H410(décima gen)/310(novena gen) con un procesador Pentium es su flexibilidad en cuanto a actualización del procesador que proporciona el chipset B450, y al ser de la generación anterior no se ve muy desbordado el precio, y en el caso de ese modelo de placa base de Gigabyte, el B450M DS3h v2 mantiene un equilibrio entre precio y acceso a la actual generación de Ryzen, Zen 3 con la versión mas actual del BIOS proporcionado por el fabricante.Y con la escasez de tarjetas de vídeo dedicadas de gama baja, que las volvió inaccesibles para la mayoría del publico, mi elección esta clara. Gracias a que se adquirió y se testeó una nueva PC con un Ryzen 5 5600x, mi decisión fue elegir este modelo de procesador para revitalizar un PC con mas de siete años a sus espaldas que monta:Un Intel Core i3 540 de primera generación, con 6 GB de RAM DDR3 a 1333 MHz, en una placa base con chipset H55 Exprees para Socket LGA1156, sacada de una Gateway DX4840, con un SSD de 120 GB Western Digital Green, un HDD de 1 TB Seagate, ambas unidades de almacenamiento son SATA, una PSU ATX Seasonic S12III Bronze modelo SSR-500GB3, de 500 Watts con certificación 80 Plus Bronze y una tarjeta de vídeo AMD Radeon R7 240 de 1 GB VRAM GDDR5 para aligerar la carga del procesador en Windows 10, pero ya estaba dando las ultimas. El cambio fue demasiado notorio, mejoro mucho el rendimiento. Al estar dedicada para tareas de oficina y para ver películas en Netflix y Youtube, su usuario de da por satisfecho. Se reutilizo casi todo los componentes, se reemplazo la placa base con su correspondiente procesador y RAM.El PC repotenciado quedo de esta manera:AMD Ryzen 3 3200g;Gigabyte B450M DS3h v2;Cooler Master hyper 212 LED modelo RR-212L-16PR-R1;RAM DDR4 Kingston HyperX Fury 8GB a 2666Mhz;PSU ATX Seasonic S12III Bronze modelo SSR-500GB3, de 500 Watts;Manhattan 101974 Lector Tarjetas Bahia Interna 3.5" USB 3.0;SSD Western Digital Green de 120 GB SATA y un HDD Seagate de 1 TB a 7200 RPM SATAFunciona de maravilla. Recomiendo solo si la PC estará dedicada para tareas ofimáticas y de ocio, aunque puede con juegos a 720 y 1080p con detalles al mínimo. Se recomienda usar 16 GB de RAM DDR4 a 3000 MHz si se desea aprovechar la iGPU a su plena capacidad.

reviews.reviewTitle: Rien a envier à la plupart des autres processeurs de sa gamme.
reviews.reviewText: Ryzen 3 efficace. Je l'ai acheté pour rénover ma deuxième tour qui me sert de PC administratif en premier lieu. Avec le temps j'ai installé plusieurs jeux (fortuite, Apex......) pour mon fils, le processeur ne faibli pas. Je possède déjà un ryzen 5 3600X et franchement la difference sur l'utilisation est à peine perceptible. Monté sur une carte mère basique AM4 avec 16Go de Ram et une carte graphique GTX 660 un peu vieillissante ce processeur est incroyable en rendement. Un SSD Tcsunbow en disque principal, cette ordinateur démarre en moins de 30 seconde, ce qui ne gâche rien. En résumé c'est un excellent possesseur pour les petits budgets.
